enb_long_title: 42nd Session of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC-42)
sentences: On Thursday, the Panel returned to the question of SRs, which had been placed on the agenda under "Other Matters," with Acting IPCC Chair El Gizouli noting that little time remained to address this issue.
The US pointed to five emerging themes among the many SR proposals: desertification; cryosphere; oceans; food and agriculture; and mitigation and adaptation linkages.
He suggested that the Bureau consider how to streamline the proposals and better represent them.
Norway requested that the Bureau continue consideration of this issue and called for a mandate for the Bureau to streamline the proposals.
Switzerland called for this issue to be considered in the scoping of the sixth assessment cycle.
Mexico supported an SR on links between adaptation and mitigation, and called for considering SRs on long-lasting climate contaminants and those with the potential for anthropogenic manipulation.
The Panel placed this item on the Bureau§s agenda.
